title: Failure to sync
body:
## Description

Summary: After interrupting lighthouse with ctrl+c, it now refuses to start back up again.

Three days ago (2022-10-23) I attempted to sync Ethereum mainnet from scratch, by running in parallel:

```
lighthouse \
          --spec mainnet \
          --network mainnet \
          --debug-level info \
          beacon_node \
          --datadir ./mainnet-lighthouse \
          --eth1 \
          --http \
          --http-allow-sync-stalled \
          --metrics \
          --merge \
          --execution-endpoints http://127.0.0.1:8551 \
          --enr-udp-port=9000 \
          --enr-tcp-port=9000 \
          --discovery-port=9000 \
          --jwt-secrets="/opt/jwtsecret" \
          --suggested-fee-recipient=redacted
```
and
```
geth \
     --datadir ./mainnet-geth \
     --http \
     --http.api="eth,web3,net" \
     --http.vhosts="*" --http.corsdomain "*" \
     --authrpc.jwtsecret=/opt/jwtsecret \
     --authrpc.vhosts="*"
```

I got these commands from tutorials on the internet, I will freely admit that I don't know what most of the options mean, so if there's some mistake in them I wouldn't be surprised.

This was running on a brand new fast 2TB SSD on a 7950X, with a fast network connection, and 128 GiB of RAM (not the RAM that had memory issues, if you saw me talking about that on Twitter!), so I assume there should be no issues with resource limitations.

After running for three days geth filled up 420 GB into `./mainnet-geth/`, and lighthouse filled up 170 GB into `./mainnet-lighthouse/`. I was unsure if ligthhouse had gotten stuck somehow, so I decided to restart it by hitting ctrl+c. Here's the tail of the lighthouse logs when I did that:

1. Run it completely fresh for three days (while geth is running in parallel).
2. Hit ctrl+c when it was in the state shown above.
3. Try to restart it.

Am I doing something obviously wrong? I assume this is a lighthouse bug, that its db somehow got wedged/corrupted from simply being shut down?

Hey, sorry about the crash.

There's a few strange things with your setup:

1. You should run Lighthouse v3.0.0 or later for mainnet. v2.5.1 does not have the config for the merge baked in and won't be able to merge correctly.
2. You should compile with the stable Rust compiler rather than nightly. Sometimes the nightly compiler has bugs that cause miscompilations, which cause issues downstream.

That aside it's possible you stumbled on a case where a race condition corrupts the database. This is _not_ common, and this is the first time we've seen a crash exactly like yours. I'm curious which filesystem & hardware you're running on, is there any virtualisation?

To patch things up you don't need to re-sync for 3 days. Lighthouse can sync in a few minutes if you use checkpoint sync: https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/checkpoint-sync.html

So I would recommend deleting your current lighthouse database, updating to the latest version and then checkpoint syncing. Once Lighthouse is synced it will start helping Geth too

Thanks so much for the tips and resources! I'll try all of that out, especially the checkpoint sync, sounds great.

There is no virtualization. Lighthouse's output directory is to ext4, which is inside of LVM, inside of LUKS, inside of a partition (I think EFI), like this:
```
nvme0n1               259:0    0   1.8T  0 disk  
└─nvme0n1p1           259:8    0   1.8T  0 part  
  └─extradrive_crypt  253:3    0   1.8T  0 crypt 
    └─edvg-extradrive 253:4    0   1.8T  0 lvm   /mnt/ed
```
This should be as bog-standard as it comes, I'd hope. My `/` as setup by Ubuntu is basically exactly the same.

(The SSD in question is a 2 TB Samsung EVO 970 Pro, in an m.2 slot on the motherboard.)

Thanks again.
